definition: original spot/previous place/where it was before
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish

sentences.english: He replaced the paper after reading it.
sentences.chinese: 他看完報，仍然放回原處。

sentences.english: In its place the nymphs found a beautiful flower.
sentences.chinese: 在屍體原處她們發現了一株美麗的花。

sentences.english: The front drawworks guard should be put back in place when the operation is completed.
sentences.chinese: 作業結束之後，要儘快把絞車前邊的護罩裝回原處。

sentences.english: At this also my heart trembleth, and is moved out of his place.
sentences.chinese: 因此我心戰兢，從原處移動。

sentences.english: He restored the umbrella he had taken by mistake.
sentences.chinese: 他把拿錯了的雨傘放回原處。

sentences.english: The air compressor has been repaired and fitted back in place.
sentences.chinese: 空氣壓縮機已被修復，裝回原處。

sentences.english: We should put the shoes in place before we decided which pair to buy.
sentences.chinese: 在我們確定買那一雙之前，我們應該將鞋子放回原處。

sentences.english: She restored the book she had taken by mistake.
sentences.chinese: 她把拿錯的書放回原處。

sentences.english: Children can clean up toys after playing.
sentences.chinese: 在遊戲後，能將玩具主動放回原處。

sentences.english: Replace the special tools to the original place.
Don't forget to put back the receiver when you've finished speaking.
sentences.chinese: 講完後別忘記把電話筒放回原處。

sentences.english: Will you please tell me how to use the card catalogue?
sentences.chinese: 請將卡片正確插回卡片箱內原處。

sentences.english: After using the telephone, please replace the handset.
sentences.chinese: 用完電話後，請把聽筒放回原處。

sentences.english: The shop-assistant dusted books and put every one in its place.
sentences.chinese: 店員把所有的書撣過灰塵，然後把每本書放回原處。
我們兜了個圈子又回到原處。

sentences.english: He snatched the pistol back, jealously; shut the knife, and returned it to its concealment.
sentences.chinese: 他猜忌地把手槍奪回去，合攏刀子，又把它藏回原處。
